alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:27AM PDT until April 11 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko NV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nevada... Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley affecting Humboldt County. For the Martin Creek...including Paradise Valley...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley. * WHEN...From this morning to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Moderate flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:55 AM PDT Monday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 6.6 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.9 feet on 07/11/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Martin Creek Paradise Valle 5.5 4.3 Mon 7 am PDT 6.6 6.6 5.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM PDT.
